greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T(n,k) counting words with n letters drawn from a k-letter alphabet with no letter appearing thrice in a 3-letter subword.
example: T(3,2) =6 counts the 3-letter words aab, aba, abb, bba, bab, baa. The words aaa and bbb are not counted.
mathematica: Table[T[n-k, k], {n, 2, 12}, {k, 1, n-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 26 2020, from Maple *)
xref: Cf. A265583 (no letter twice), A265624. A000290 (row 2), A007531 (row 3), A006355 (column 2), A121907 (column 3), A123620 (column 4), A123871 (column 5), A123887 (column 6).
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 10 2015
